intro: Macrocalyx micranthus, commonly known as the small-flowered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, tubular flowers. The plant typically features small, clustered leaves and produces numerous tiny, white or pale blue flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or grassland habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
